title: What are Row Operations?
text: Row operations are operations that can be performed on the rows of a matrix to simplify it or put it into a more useful form, especially when solving systems of linear equations or performing matrix transformations.

title: Types of Row Operations
text: There are three types of basic row operations: Row swapping, row scaling, and row addition.

title: Applications of Row Operations
text: These row operations are primarily used in methods like Gaussian elimination and Gauss-Jordan elimination to reduce matrices to simpler forms, such as row echelon form or reduced row echelon form.
